content:
The Dino-Mite Tour is a fantastic way to explore the Natural History Museum's dinosaur exhibits with a knowledgeable guide. Here are the details:

**Tour duration:** The Dino-Mite Tour typically lasts around 45 minutes to 1 hour.

**Age range:** The tour is designed for kids aged 5-12 years old. However, younger siblings (accompanied by an adult) or older kids who are dinosaur enthusiasts are also welcome to join in on the fun!

**Tour content:** During the tour, your guide will take your group on an adventure through the dinosaur galleries, sharing fascinating facts and stories about the prehistoric creatures on display. They'll highlight some of the most impressive and intriguing dinosaur fossils, including the Diplodocus, T. rex, and Triceratops.

**Interactive elements:** The tour is designed to be engaging and interactive, with opportunities for kids to ask questions, participate in discussions, and even get hands-on with some dinosaur-themed activities.

**Group size:** The tour group size is usually limited to ensure a more personalized experience for all participants.

**Meeting point:** You'll meet your guide at a designated location within the museum, usually near the dinosaur exhibits.

Remember to book your Dino-Mite Tour tickets in advance, especially during peak seasons or school holidays, as they tend to fill up quickly.

Have a roar-some time on the Dino-Mite Tour with your niece!
